featured.text: By 1955, he had completed an improved version of the product, with each square inch of material containing 300 hooks, which made it stay fastened and yet easy enough to pull apart when needed.
In the early days of aviation, plane windows 17 square in shape.
In 1790, President George Washington declared that the federal government would reside in a district “not exceeding ten miles square … on the river Potomac.”

other.text: The tower, of pinewood, will be built on eight pillars and will be topped with a flower of five metal petals of 700 square meters each.
The ice sheets, which once spanned 20 square kilometers, are thinning over five times as quickly compared to a few years ago.
One of the most distinctive features of the kilt is the pattern of squares, or sett, it exhibits.
When subjected to repeated pressurization high in the sky, the four corners on a square window may 19 .
28 already shrunk by 85% to a mere 0.5 square kilometers, Papua’s glaciers will completely disappear within a decade, researchers have predicted.

definition.zh_def: 正方形；四邊相等且四個角均為直角的平面圖形。
definition.en_def: A shape with four equal sides and four right angles.
definition.example: The table has a square top.
